description: Creates a unified summary integrating all previous analysis phases. Enhanced with evolution timeline construction, multi-work trace aggregation, convergence/divergence detection, and indirect enabler analysis — enabling cross-work intellectual genealogy synthesis.
researcher_question: What is the unified picture of how this concept functions across a body of work?

semantic_core.concept_name: string - concise name of the concept
semantic_core.unified_definition: string - synthesized definition integrating all perspectives
key_tensions: string - unresolved or productive tensions in how this concept functions
semantic_core.argumentative_role: string - what role this concept plays in the overall argument across texts

supporting_claims: string - claims that support or derive from this concept
dependent_concepts: string - concepts that depend on this one
enabling_assumptions: string - what must be true for this concept to work as the author uses it
logical_vulnerabilities: string - where the argumentative use of this concept is weakest

stages.form: string - how the concept appeared in this work (proto-form, full form, modified, etc.)
stages.transition_to_next: string - what changed between this work and the next in the timeline

current_form.description: string - how the concept appears in the current (most recent) work
current_form.key_quote: string - most representative quote from the current work

evolution_timelines.evolution_narrative: string - 2-3 paragraph narrative of how this concept evolved across the author's body of work
evolution_timelines.total_span_years: string - time span from earliest to current appearance
evolution_timelines.works_in_timeline: number - how many works this concept appears in

strongest_traces: string - the most significant traces across all works
traces_by_concept.evolution_summary: string - synthesis of how this concept changed across all works where it was found
traces_by_concept.consistency_assessment: string - how consistent is the concept across works? Where does it diverge?

most_evolved_concepts: string - concepts that changed the most across the corpus
most_stable_concepts: string - concepts that remained remarkably consistent
orphan_concepts: string - concepts in the current work with no detectable ancestry in prior works

convergence_points.description: string - where ideas from different prior works converge in the current work
contributing_works: string - which prior works feed into this convergence
convergence_points.what_converges: string - what specific ideas or patterns come together
convergence_points.synthesis_quality: string - how well the author integrates these different influences

divergence_points.description: string - where ideas from different prior works conflict or pull in different directions
conflicting_works: string - which prior works create the tension
divergence_points.what_conflicts: string - what specific ideas or patterns are in tension
divergence_points.how_author_manages: string - does the author acknowledge, resolve, suppress, or ignore the tension?

hidden_dependencies: string - ideas from the current work that depend on specific prior work evolution paths that aren't acknowledged

foundational_patterns_from_contextualize: string - foundational patterns from indirect contextualizer works that shaped how this concept developed, even if those works never discussed the concept directly
cross_domain_imports: string - methods or frameworks imported from different-field works that influenced this concept's development
indirect_enablers.how_indirect_works_shaped_evolution: string - narrative of how the author's broader intellectual toolkit (from non-direct-precursor works) influenced this concept's trajectory

canonical_schema.what_was_gained: string - what the evolution added in terms of analytical power, scope, or precision
canonical_schema.what_was_lost: string - what was present in earlier versions but abandoned, narrowed, or forgotten
canonical_schema.intermediate_influences: string - what external events, intellectual encounters, or historical changes may have driven changes between works

critical_verdict.overall_assessment: string - integrated critical assessment of this concept across the body of work
strengths: string - what works well about how this concept functions
weaknesses: string - what doesn't work or is problematic
unacknowledged_debts: string - intellectual debts the author doesn't acknowledge
alternative_paths_not_taken: string - plausible directions the author could have taken but didn't

key_findings: string - notable observations about the synthesis

extraction.core_question: What is the unified picture of how this concept functions across a body of work?
extraction_steps: SEMANTIC CORE: Establish the synthesized definition of the concept, integrating all perspectives from across texts. Identify key tensions and the concept's argumentative role.
ARGUMENTATIVE ARCHITECTURE: Map how this concept supports other claims, what depends on it, what assumptions enable it, and where its logical vulnerabilities lie.

EVOLUTION TIMELINE CONSTRUCTION: For each concept that appears in 2+ works, reconstruct the chronological timeline of its evolution. Arrange all appearances chronologically. For each transition between works, identify what changed — in emphasis, scope, framing, evidence base, or conclusion. Track the framing trajectory: tentative → definitive escalation is a critical genealogical signal.
CLASSIFY EVOLUTION PATTERN: For each timeline, determine the overall evolution pattern — is this gradual refinement, sharp reversal, silent drift, strategic reframing, or consistent deepening?
WRITE EVOLUTION NARRATIVE: For each significant timeline, compose a 2-3 paragraph narrative that tells the story of the concept's evolution. Focus on the TRAJECTORY, not just individual appearances.

MULTI-WORK TRACE AGGREGATION: Merge traces from all prior works into a unified view per concept. Which concepts changed most? Which remained stable? Which concepts in the current work have no detectable ancestry (orphan concepts)?

CONVERGENCE DETECTION: Where do ideas from different prior works converge in the current work? Identify points where separately evolved ideas come together, and assess the quality of the author's synthesis.

DIVERGENCE DETECTION: Where do ideas from different prior works conflict or pull in different directions? Identify tensions the author manages (or suppresses) and hidden dependencies on specific evolution paths.

INDIRECT ENABLERS: Review foundational patterns and cross-domain transfers from non-direct-precursor works. How did the author's broader intellectual toolkit — methods, frameworks, cognitive habits from contextualizer and different-field works — influence the concept's trajectory? Some of the most important evolutionary drivers come from works that never discussed the concept directly.
GAINS AND LOSSES: What did the evolution add? What was abandoned or forgotten? Be honest about what was lost, not just what was gained.

CRITICAL VERDICT: Integrate all analysis into a critical assessment. What are the unacknowledged debts? What alternative paths were not taken? What strengths and weaknesses does the concept have as it currently functions?

key_fields.convergence_divergence: Where ideas from different works interact

extraction.special_instructions: When used for genealogical synthesis: Focus on the TRAJECTORY of each concept, not just individual appearances. The value is in seeing the arc of development across works. Pay special attention to what drove transitions — was it new evidence, changing political context, intellectual influence, or strategic positioning? Be honest about what was lost in evolution, not just what was gained. IMPORTANT: The evolution of a concept is shaped not only by works that directly discuss it (direct precursors) but also by the author's broader intellectual toolkit from indirect contextualizer and different-field works. When prior analysis data includes foundational_patterns or cross_domain_transfers, integrate these into the evolution narrative — they explain HOW and WHY the concept evolved in the way it did. If Runtime Context is provided, adapt your analysis accordingly.

consolidation_rules: ORDER TIMELINES CHRONOLOGICALLY: Ensure all timeline entries are in temporal order
VERIFY CROSS-REFERENCES: Ensure concept_ids match across evolution timelines and traces
AGGREGATE TRACES: Merge per-work traces into unified per-concept summaries
IDENTIFY CONVERGENCES: Find where separately evolved ideas come together in the current work
FLAG CONTRADICTIONS: Highlight where evolution paths create tensions
RANK BY SIGNIFICANCE: Order concepts by their genealogical significance and analytical importance
